1.9 Utility designator classes

clear-memory!

Function

Summary

Stores zeros in the specified bytes of memory.

Signature

clear-memory!pointer, size => ()

Arguments

pointer
An instance of type <pointer> that points to the memory location at which to start writing zeros.

size
An instance of type <integer>. The number of bytes to clear.

Library

c-ffi

Module

c-ffi

Description

Stores zeros into size bytes of memory beginning at pointer. The space is assumed to be a whole number of words and word-aligned.

C FFI and Win 32 Reference - 31 MAR 2000
